snippet: Federal Reserve officials are reluctant to provide further stimulus, but the slowing rate of job creation suggests they have not done enough.
abstract: News analysis; disappointing jobs report makes it likely that the Federal Reserve will reluctantly provide another stimulus in an attempt to bolster the economic recovery; Fed's original 2008 stimulus was at the time considered an unprecedented, one-time move, but the economy has proved increasingly unable to wean itself from dependence on the flow of aid.
lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials are reluctant to provide further stimulus, but the slowing rate of job creation suggests they have not done enough.

headline.seo: Weak Hiring May Force the Fed to Act Again — News Analysis
headline.main: Jobs Report Makes Federal Reserve More Likely to Act
headline.print_headline: Weak Hiring May Sway The Fed to Act Again
